name: Where2Meet
description: Find the best spots to meet halfway between you and your friends by public transit.

name: MemoReplay
description: Web app designed to help dementia patients recall events in their past through questions and prompts about the photos in their camera roll.

name: Weenix
description: Fully functional Unix-based operating system kernel, built as a semester-long project in Brown University's [CS 1690](https://github.com/brown-cs1690/handout/wiki/Weenix-Operating-System) (Operating Systems). Implementation includes threads and processes, device drivers, a persistent file system, and virtual memory.

name: Scheduler
description: Employee scheduler for the Brown University CS Department's Sunlab Consultants. The scheduler uses linear programming to solve for an optimal schedule, accounting for employee preferences and departmental policies.

name: TuneUtils
description: Assortment of quick web tools for Spotify that provide user interfaces for otherwise API-only functionality.

name: Hugmaker
description: Discord chatbot that generates custom emoji from flags or user profile pictures. The bot uses OpenCV and the Twemoji set.

name: Overtonic
description: Program that determines the identity of an instrument based on the musical overtones of its sound, using fast Fourier transforms.

name: Back to Drive
description: Chrome extension that reverts the button link on the upper left of Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides pages back to what it used to be, drive.google.com.

name: DeathSwap
description: Minecraft plugin that implements Dream's version of the minigame DeathSwap, originally conceived by SethBling.
